title: FAA grants commercial launch license to Blue Origin’s New Glenn rocket
summary: The important test is one of final big hurdles for Blue Origin to clear before it’s ready to launch on its inaugural orbital flight. Blue Origin didn't announce a launch date following the FAA's announcement of its launch license approval.

title: Slam Corp extends Lynk Global merger deadline as cash reserves dwindle
summary:
Slam Corp, the shell company founded by former MLB player Alex Rodriguez, extended its merger deadline with Lynk Global but must refund $81 million to investors who redeemed shares instead of seeking a stake in the direct-to-smartphone satellite operator.
The post Slam Corp extends Lynk Global merger deadline as cash reserves dwindle appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Makes History With Closest Pass to Sun
summary: Operations teams have confirmed NASA’s mission to “touch” the Sun survived its record-breaking closest approach to the solar surface on Dec. 24, 2024. Breaking its previous record by flying just 3.8 million miles above the surface of the Sun, NASA’s Parker Solar Probe hurtled through the solar atmosphere at a blazing 430,000 miles per hour […]

title: Hubble Spies a Cosmic Eye
summary: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image features the spiral galaxy NGC 2566, which sits 76 million light-years away in the constellation Puppis. A prominent bar of stars stretches across the center of this galaxy, and spiral arms emerge from each end of the bar. Because NGC 2566 appears tilted from our perspective, its disk takes on an […]

title: Nelson: Decision on Mars Sample Return expected before new administration takes office
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson said teams were meeting at the Kennedy Space Center on Friday, Dec. 20, to make some of the final determinations about how they will return dozens of samples from the Red Planet.

title: Spacecoin deploys first satellite for decentralized space connectivity
summary:
Spacecoin said it is successfully communicating with a recently launched debut connectivity satellite, designed to test technology for a decentralized space-based network shared by multiple investors.
